commit_message:
cinder os-detach api returns 500

If invalid 'attachment_id' is passed to the os-detach
api, then it returns 500 error because even though
VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception is raised from manager,
it gets converted to RemoteError due to rpcapi call.

Caught RemoteError exception in the api and returned 400
error to the user if exception type is VolumeAttachmentNotFound
OR InvalidVolume. In other cases 500 error is raised.

Fixed typo in comment of volume manager.

Closes-Bug: 1449870
Change-Id: I92b03e0af3b7ab517e34edaeffd88f0a00516000

commit_message:
cinderclient no longer honors --endpoint-type

Commit for "Enable version discovery":
ae03d2a721bd9acb61805ce792a27fb7cf88e5cd
breaks CLI use of --endpoint-type. This is because we were using the
default interface instead of checking to see if an endpoint_type is
passed in.

Change-Id: I412bb6b4bcb9bf10aa6118a2ed43e28cbd3ed236
Closes-Bug: 1454407

commit_message:
Use catalog=True for package_loader queries

Package loader attempts to load packages during deployment, therefore it
needs to see all the packages it can deploy, therefore it needs
catalog=True context for that.
This is related to api behaviour change, that allows packages api to
distinct between packages one can deploy and packages one can edit.

Change-Id: I5ffdc2728202f212408b9a5b4b6b267084c5723d
Closes-Bug: #1452942

commit_message:
Bump pre-release to 2015.1.1 and fix cli tests

There are multiple changes in this commit:
* Bumpt version in setup.cfg
* Add nose to test-requirements (because devstack no longer installs it)
* Fix CLI tests configuration

Most of the changes copied from similar commit from master

Change-Id: Ic59f91ff541f2dac25d911dedfb7028c0ac4b516

commit_message:
Use catalog=True for app_by_fqn helper function

app_by_fqn is used to query app images when building topology and during
updates of certain dynamic ui componenents. Both context might require
access to public apps from different tenants, therefore the function
should use catalog=True

Change-Id: I2ae4b5dfa55d72c1e384467afdcd64f4bd62ecf0
Closes-Bug: #1454674

App Dev Guide: Murano packages

 - Package structure

commit_message:
added role to pin packages

This new role is now providing the ability for a user to pin apt
packages as they see fit. The idea is to allow someone to implement
pinning in a generic way that can be represented as a global variable
or as a hostvar. The new role has been added to all install roles as
a dependency which will allow it to ensure that packages are pinned
everywhere as would be expected.

Change-Id: I354e8515570fa7174366ba57d57aece3c304568e

commit_message:
Updated cinder nfs variable name so that it'll work

The variable was nfs_client but it needs to be cinder_nfs_client
this commit renames that variable so that it'll function as
expected.

Change-Id: I09ab7eb2ed34237c41132596e998c7b24cd03f1f
Closes-Bug: 1453271

commit_message:
Updated cinder nfs variable name so that it'll work

The variable was nfs_client but it needs to be cinder_nfs_client
this commit renames that variable so that it'll function as
expected.

Change-Id: I09ab7eb2ed34237c41132596e998c7b24cd03f1f
Closes-Bug: 1453271
(cherry picked from commit f519817736a2c7490a9a417092ee4d22cfd6a3b3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 14:45:26.000000000', 'message': 'Double-quote all strings in astute.yaml

Puppet sometimes interprets a mac address as a
numeric value and not a string. For this reason,
it is necessary to enclose all values in quotes
to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I68e3d558768d9f0afe7b8a60d9360cf257c92340
Closes-Bug: #1454708
'}]
commit_message:
Double-quote all strings in astute.yaml

Puppet sometimes interprets a mac address as a
numeric value and not a string. For this reason,
it is necessary to enclose all values in quotes
to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I68e3d558768d9f0afe7b8a60d9360cf257c92340
Closes-Bug: #1454708

commit_message:
Create behaviors for secrets

To prevent violations of DRY this CR will create behaviors for
secrets that will be available to other barbican resource testcases.

Change-Id: I075b89156e8af6c0a2b0e196a5f3e70c6b41160d

This new role is now providing the ability for a user to pin apt
packages as they see fit. The idea is to allow someone to implement
pinning in a generic way that can be represented as a global variable
or as a hostvar. The new role has been added to all install roles as
a dependency which will allow it to ensure that packages are pinned
everywhere as would be expected.

Change-Id: I354e8515570fa7174366ba57d57aece3c304568e
(cherry picked from commit f139eb09d43be7f13d227f3893ac7ee05f1e36d6)

commit_message:
added role to pin packages

This new role is now providing the ability for a user to pin apt
packages as they see fit. The idea is to allow someone to implement
pinning in a generic way that can be represented as a global variable
or as a hostvar. The new role has been added to all install roles as
a dependency which will allow it to ensure that packages are pinned
everywhere as would be expected.

Change-Id: I354e8515570fa7174366ba57d57aece3c304568e
(cherry picked from commit f139eb09d43be7f13d227f3893ac7ee05f1e36d6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 16:19:20.000000000', 'message': 'Decouple $sync_db from $enabled

Having to set both $enabled and $sync_db to true for the DB sync to
happen breaks use cases when the service should stay completely
unmanaged (not enabled, not started), but DB sync should still happen.
For versatility of the module, the $enabled and $sync_db conditions
should be decoupled.

Change-Id: I2a0a76b54ebedba1ec098b8c64bd8e9684ed3099
Closes-Bug: #1452278
'}]
commit_message:
Decouple $sync_db from $enabled

Having to set both $enabled and $sync_db to true for the DB sync to
happen breaks use cases when the service should stay completely
unmanaged (not enabled, not started), but DB sync should still happen.
For versatility of the module, the $enabled and $sync_db conditions
should be decoupled.

Change-Id: I2a0a76b54ebedba1ec098b8c64bd8e9684ed3099
Closes-Bug: #1452278

commit_message:
Introduce creds_provider in test.py

A lot of code works on the assumption that test classes has
an attribute exactly called "isolated_creds".
Define a new property on test classes that provides a
credential provider for the tests.

Change-Id: I404357be4c9fb2079332eed614bd61eee6ae6dc1
Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 21:37:14.000000000', 'message': "Expect a single host; remove ACONF.pvm_host_mtms

The neutron-powervm driver will operate on a native management partition
which manages only the host on which it resides.  There is therefore no
need to specify that host's MTMS in the configuration; and it is an
error if the PowerVM REST API does not return exactly one host.

Change-Id: Id78373d3b86224a12bffdbd206348922732b2f69
"}]
commit_message:
Expect a single host; remove ACONF.pvm_host_mtms

The neutron-powervm driver will operate on a native management partition
which manages only the host on which it resides.  There is therefore no
need to specify that host's MTMS in the configuration; and it is an
error if the PowerVM REST API does not return exactly one host.

Change-Id: Id78373d3b86224a12bffdbd206348922732b2f69

Remove unused parameter

Right now, the container api controller has parameter not
used anywhere. so we remove those.

Change-Id: I332e8c810f84bc31cb3de68cb7ea40bfaea5cbc3

[{'created': '2015-03-27 15:14:05.000000000', 'message': 'Extend get_client_manager to support roles

A lot of code works on the assumption that test classes has
an attribute exactly called "isolated_creds".
Define a new property on test classes that provides a
credential provider for the tests.

the credentials by role case, so that tests can rely always on this
function to get a client manager.

commit_message:
Extend get_client_manager to support roles

Extends get_client_manager to support the credentials by role case,
so that tests can rely always on this function to get a client manager.

Change-Id: I42ce8dfdd2b4ce1ed2dda307dc3b782fd7f4a8a5
Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

[{'created': '2015-05-13 11:07:33.000000000', 'message': "Allow ml2.test_rpc to be run by testtools

The __init__ method of TypeManager requires the config group ml2,
however it doesn't import ml2.config that it where the group is
registered. When the test is run using tox/testr the file is
imported during test discovery, this doesn't happen with testtools.

Closes-bug: #1454640
Change-Id: I478e0a50bb6ebecfb74c3351c4d2c72fc0a96d6d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ml2.test_rpc to be run by testtools

The __init__ method of TypeManager requires the config group ml2,
however it doesn't import ml2.config that it where the group is
registered. When the test is run using tox/testr the file is
imported during test discovery, this doesn't happen with testtools.

Closes-bug: #1454640
Change-Id: I478e0a50bb6ebecfb74c3351c4d2c72fc0a96d6d

commit_message:
stop mocking os.path in test_setup_events_default_config

test_setup_events_default_config unnecessarily mocks os.path.exists.
this seems to be causing failures when running tox -edebug --
test_setup_events_default_config (and occasionally in gate). it's
dangerous to mock os.path because other libs might depend on it so
let's stop mocking it.

Change-Id: Ibe9027874f597348c5da6c92899cf8740eb678c2
Closes-Bug: #1449604
(cherry picked from commit c3b58d7dd2298d343cf88df22e0a60de060393fc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 21:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Expect a single host; remove CONF.pvm_host_mtms

The nova-powervm driver will operate on a native management partition
which manages only the host on which it resides.  There is therefore no
need to specify that host's MTMS in the configuration; and it is an
error if the PowerVM REST API does not return exactly one host.

Change-Id: I0f77add7c09760a54c8d7662bfe3c6810095620b
"}]
commit_message:
Expect a single host; remove CONF.pvm_host_mtms

The nova-powervm driver will operate on a native management partition
which manages only the host on which it resides.  There is therefore no
need to specify that host's MTMS in the configuration; and it is an
error if the PowerVM REST API does not return exactly one host.

Change-Id: I0f77add7c09760a54c8d7662bfe3c6810095620b

commit_message:
stop mocking os.path in test_setup_events_default_config

test_setup_events_default_config unnecessarily mocks os.path.exists.
this seems to be causing failures when running tox -edebug --
test_setup_events_default_config (and occasionally in gate). it's
dangerous to mock os.path because other libs might depend on it so
let's stop mocking it.

Change-Id: Ibe9027874f597348c5da6c92899cf8740eb678c2
Closes-Bug: #1449604
(cherry picked from commit c3b58d7dd2298d343cf88df22e0a60de060393fc)

commit_message:
Set mtu for internal networks according to segmentation type

Currently MTU for Neutron private networks is always set to 1500,
which is not correct for GRE segmentation and causes performance degradation.
MTU value should also depend on MTU settings of physical interfaces.
The only way to change MTU for Neutron private network is to use an additional
dnsmasq configuration file.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Vasilenko <svasilenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Iaa9631b58f268ec414c58d1b7c47de3573772fc5
Closes-bug: #1411732

commit_message:
Add patch for consistency group update in ProphetStor driver

BP consistency-groups-kilo-update has introduced CG Modification
support. This patch is adding support for the new API in
ProphetStor driver.

This patch also included styling changes which replaced \ with
().

Change-Id: I256f320d2563b247a2493301638a7699b66a83b6
Implements: blueprint cg-modified-prophetstor

commit_message:
Adding possibility to mark all Tempest tests as failed

In some cases it is convinient to mark all Tempest tests as failed.
Now the script "report_tempest_results.py" provides such possibility.

Change-Id: I4307f5ce33da98eb6f466a380311b8ed3d34328c

commit_message:
Update build hooks.

The pbr setup_hook has not been needed for a while, so remove it.  The
neutron hook has been broken for a while: it places a setup_requires
build dependency on everything in neutron/__init__.py, which is
non-empty, but setup_requires is handled by easy install so we try
very hard to avoid it. Instead, we can use environment markers to
selectively include the win32 dependencies without requiring that
neutron be importable during setup.py execution. This is unusual
in OpenStack and will eventually be moved to a regular
requirements.txt dependency with the same marker - once we've finished
the integration work to make markers work properly in
requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Icdc403a3ccf06daeccf2a907a7bfeafd8dbbb5dd

I ported delattr support in from nova underneath you, and also added tests for update() and delitem. The rest of my -1 comments from the previous set still apply.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-13 00:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2015-05-13 09:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

I put my patch in the work in progress state. The current approach using a metaclass doesn't work because nova uses a different metaclass, and a class cannot have two metaclasses (except if one inherits from the other, which is not the case and it wouldn't make sense here).

I will rework my patch to support dict(obj) without the mutable mapping metaclass.

>> This change adds also Python 3 support.
> Can you remove this please? We already run python3 tests on every commit.

Well, I mean that I would like to fix the API to implement Python 3 dictionary API: items() should return an iterator on Python 3, not a list.

>> [remove iteritems on Python 3]
> I don't think you should remove this. Yes, a python3 puritan would NEVER assume the presence of an iteritems() on something that purported to be dict-like. However, mortal humans may have, and thus removing it is not okay, IMHO.

A "Python 3 puritan" lol, thank you :-)

We might deprecate it later, but I'm ok to keep it in this change. My main concern here is to support dict(obj) to be able to replace dict(obj.iteritems()) with dict(obj) in nova, to avoid having to use six.iteritems() on such pattern.

> How about just: return len(self.fields)?

Hum, I'm not sure that it would work: len(obj) should be the same than list(iter(obj)) no? The __iter__ method skips fields if self.obj_attr_is_set() return False (and it's not an extra field).'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2015-05-13 14:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I wrote a different patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182699/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 22:16:34.000000000', 'message': "VersionedObjectDictCompat inherits MutableMapping

Reusing the MutableMapping abstract base class in
VersionedObjectDictCompat to not have to reimplement all dictionary
methods. Only implement __getitem__, __setitem__, __delitem__, __iter__
and __len__.

Remove also notes previously copied from Nova. Since
oslo.versionedobjects is now a library, removing a class now requires a
deprecation warning which is more useful than a note. Removing the
dictionary API from VersionedObjectDictCompat doesn't make sense. Nova
may drop the dictionary API from Nova objects, but not the
VersionedObjectDictCompat class.

This change adds also Python 3 support. On Python 3, MutableMapping
defines correctly items() and keys() methods: return iterators, not
list.

The change removes VersionedObjectDictCompat.iteritems() on Python 3. No
OpenStack application using oslo.versionedobjects is compatible with
Python 3, so this change has no impact of backward compatibility. The
class didn't have iterkeys() or itervalues() methods.

Change-Id: Iecaf355e94afef1742dc870677bcdc8a18466e83

commit_message:
VersionedObjectDictCompat inherits MutableMapping

Reusing the MutableMapping abstract base class in
VersionedObjectDictCompat to not have to reimplement all dictionary
methods. Only implement __getitem__, __setitem__, __delitem__, __iter__
and __len__.

dict(obj.iteritems()) can now be simplified to dict(obj).

Remove also notes previously copied from Nova. Since
oslo.versionedobjects is now a library, removing a class now requires a
deprecation warning which is more useful than a note. Removing the
dictionary API from VersionedObjectDictCompat doesn't make sense. Nova
may drop the dictionary API from Nova objects, but not the
VersionedObjectDictCompat class.

This change adds also Python 3 support. On Python 3, MutableMapping
defines correctly items() and keys() methods: return iterators, not
list.

The change removes VersionedObjectDictCompat.iteritems() on Python 3. No
OpenStack application using oslo.versionedobjects is compatible with
Python 3, so this change has no impact of backward compatibility. The
class didn't have iterkeys() or itervalues() methods.

Change-Id: Iecaf355e94afef1742dc870677bcdc8a18466e83

commit_message:
Stop leaking server objects

We should not be returning raw client objects when creating or
rebuilding a server.

The usage document is updated to indicate that access to resource
values via attribute is deprecated, and the examples in the README
now reflect dict-style access.

Change-Id: Iac38d4c0b29f867cc3cefaccf48c1c3fcd17a3d9

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 11:15:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Jay, thanks very much for pointing those out:


For the NeutronScale, we can't add it until we get https://github.com/cwolferh/puppet-pacemaker/commit/59fe631609de3543cbb9082f631ea0a5a118a472 (it has landed but not sure what we are using currently v.wise) because we can't pass the clone options (without it scale fails to be added as a resource properly).

For the cleanup agents I am adding them (easy enough, but am not sure if I should add the OCF or the systemd resource since both show up e.g. systemd:neutron-netns-cleanup and ocf:neutron:NetnsCleanup are both things. Perhaps we need both, I am trying to understand the differences between the types of resources). Again though the clone options must wait for ^^^ but only interleave is set in this case.

There are two types of constraints expressed in the ref arch, service dependencies and colocations. The former are addressed by the Service chains '->'. I am still trying to find out more about how to express colocation in the manifests.


thanks, marios"}, {'account_id': 7984, 'date': '2015-05-08 12:32:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

>For the NeutronScale, we can't add it until we get >https://github.com/cwolferh/puppet->pacemaker/commit/59fe631609de3543cbb9082f631ea0a5a118a472 (it >has landed but not sure what we are using currently v.wise) because we >can't pass the clone options (without it scale fails to be added as a >resource properly).
Ah, that is too bad, Jirka asked me to not merge that puppet-pacemaker patch yet since it will require some rework of the other pacemaker patches that has already been merged.  I guess for the next sprint, we'll have to do a second round with those extra bits/cleanup.
>For the cleanup agents I am adding them (easy enough, but am not sure >if I should add the OCF or the systemd resource since both show up e.g. >systemd:neutron-netns-cleanup and ocf:neutron:NetnsCleanup are both >things. Perhaps we need both, I am trying to understand the differences >between the types of resources). Again though the clone options must >wait for ^^^ but only interleave is set in this case.
My understanding from Juno is that we use the ocf service for these, they should run only at startup as I recall it. You can see how we called these in Juno [1].
>There are two types of constraints expressed in the ref arch, service >dependencies and colocations. The former are addressed by the Service >chains '->'. I am still trying to find out more about how to express >colocation in the manifests.

The chains are fine for the initial setup, but they do not help at all in the case of a reboot, that is what the pacemaker constraints are for. The thing to remember here is that systemd is NOT managing the services after initial setup, pacemaker is.  You can see examples how to do this from our quickstack code for neutron[1]. 

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/astapor/blob/master/puppet/modules/quickstack/manifests/pacemaker/neutron.pp#L243
[2] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/astapor/blob/master/puppet/modules/quickstack/manifests/pacemaker/neutron.pp#L281"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 12:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

thanks man this is very helpful... I also found https://github.com/redhat-openstack/puppet-pacemaker/blob/master/manifests/constraint/colocation.pp so playing with the syntax now'}, {'account_id': 7984, 'date': '2015-05-08 14:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

YOu are welcome.  The quickstack class is just a wrapper for the colo class in puppet-pacemaker.  We added a wrapper to make sure it only ran on one node in the cluster, though I think pcs has resolved that bug (which was an issue in pcs itself we were working around)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 14:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

yeah, i am using what's in https://github.com/redhat-openstack/puppet-pacemaker - seems to be working ok. the only thing i can't get working yet is the options for the scale (        options => "globally-unique=true clone-max=3 interleave=true" ) - gonna send out a review in a bit if the next run is green - it adds quite a block! (constraint and colocation for each)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 14:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-08 14:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

isn't she a beaut?"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 15:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from neutron-agents to pacemaker-neutron-agents'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2015-05-08 15:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

commit_message:
Adds neutron-server and agents as pacemaker resources

Adds neutron-server, neutron-l3-agent, neutron-dhcp-agent,
neutron-openvswitch-agent and neutron-metadata-agent  as
pacemaker resources.

Change-Id: I15e6decc3ad1813d3734c33e8b01e5356f4e3c70

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 11:32:13.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate deployment on nodes that are marked for deletion

Running deployment on nodes that are going to be removed from
cluster can lead to undesired destructive effects.
For particular case see related bugs.

In order to prevent such possibility - deployment action wil be
deprecated in case some nodes are marked for deletion.

commit_message:
Deprecate deployment on nodes that are marked for deletion

Running deployment on nodes that are going to be removed from
cluster can lead to undesired destructive effects.
For particular case see related bugs.

In order to prevent such possibility - deployment action wil be
deprecated in case some nodes are marked for deletion.

User then will be able to remove them from deployment group,
or remove pending_deletion flag and deploy them - if pending_deletion
was set by mistake

Change-Id: I3622492ba5eeec3de8300effd0fa98602916601f
Related-Bug: 1454617
Closes-Bug: 1454622

as far as i can tell and we are actively working on

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/python-k8sclient

So let's get rid of this, as we cannot justify adding

commit_message:
Remove dependency on python-kubernetes

python-kubernetes used to be in:
https://github.com/cosmos-io/python-kubernetes/
now it is in:
https://github.com/pjs7678/python-kubernetes/

However, we are not even using that in current code
as far as i can tell and we are actively working on
python-k8client:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/python-k8sclient

So let's get rid of this, as we cannot justify adding
this to the global requirements as it is not that actively
maintainer and as it does not support python3

Change-Id: I15310f66ecdcd1fb0496e41e5311cebbba3ba706

commit_message:
TOSCA: Create a test CLI program

This program provide a good usage to test the Heat-Translator tool on the
command line with expection of similar usage via Heat python client in near
future. The TOSCA hello world use case is implemented for quick testing
as well.

implements blueprint tosca-translator-cli-test-utility

Change-Id: Ia4ddf65aafcbe440ea9551ccc2648de4a7c88c97

commit_message:
Set 'mtu=65000' for private network patchcord

While we create private bridge and connect it to corresponded linux
bridge we should define maximum MTU for transit patchcord.

P.S: the patch was reverted due to bugs in puppet manifests.

Depends-On: Iaa9631b58f268ec414c58d1b7c47de3573772fc5
Depends-On: I3491392ff401fe65220593f47a66840f42eb4e30

Closes-Bug: #1453145

Change-Id: Icbfb26344c6b05ab518ef0a8537059bf33baffa5
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Use management_vrouter_vip as ntp server for sync

1)Start using management_vrouter_vip for ntp sync
in the test external_ntp_ha_flat
2)Add new method get_management_vrouter_vip

Change-Id: Id19d8097b351c60fb346672f1ee0aa74be9f580a
Closes-Bug: #1443647

commit_message:
Basic object store container functional tests

Basic object store container functional tests along with some
changes so that setUp and tearDown can create and destroy the
test object.  The group_regex gets each class to run on one
process.

Change-Id: Ibffb3cd61976e7db3c4199c627b30af2fa15f652

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-24 16:33:41.000000000', 'message': "Use persistent names for journal devices

On systems with multiple disk controllers drive names
will not be consistent. On reboot an OSD's journal may
have changed names which will prevent the OSD from starting.
Instead we will attempt to use the persistent by-id link
and fall back to the device name (e.g. /dev/sda) if it's
not present.

Change-Id: I18f3c1cb31dedf9e759edf0094ebce1fdb42492d
Closes-bug: #1441434
"}]
commit_message:
Use persistent names for journal devices

On systems with multiple disk controllers drive names
will not be consistent. On reboot an OSD's journal may
have changed names which will prevent the OSD from starting.
Instead we will attempt to use the persistent by-id link
and fall back to the device name (e.g. /dev/sda) if it's
not present.

Change-Id: I18f3c1cb31dedf9e759edf0094ebce1fdb42492d
Closes-bug: #1441434

commit_message:
VNX Cinder driver Over Subscription Support

Add over subscription support in EMC VNX Cinder driver

Change-Id: I2c9b5c605f9f938e5582a823da1ff2054c8d328a
Implements: blueprint vnx-over-subscription-thin-provisioning

commit_message:
Fix tenant isolation and unit tests with py3

This commit fixes several issues in the tenant isolation code and it's
unit tests which were preventing them from passing on python3.

Change-Id: I78d14b64282ae9a8d2d5edc3de65c249681bc13a

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_keystone_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

Change-Id: Ic51377f916b4f36afbcb73cac5381fbee2ed073d
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_keystone_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.
* rabbitmq: install module from source and on RH, install erlang before rabbitmq-server.

Change-Id: I3508c5908d4bf056485ce069d90a406ef1888474
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_keystone_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

Change-Id: I9c5a505b6e004e21a0df8cc92b8cf32c2d2a48ca
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Make "random" name more random

It would be nice to generate random part using uppercased, lowercased letters
and digits.

Simple example - 5 symbols are length of random part:
 - old implementation: 65 780 combinations
 - new implementation: 6 471 002 combinations

Change-Id: I65120ebac1d1bab9d8fb9d3d5e1216d0afb89209

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-10 16:06:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix routerid constraint migration

The migration to add a fk constraint to the routerl3agentbindings
table could fail if orphaned records existed.  This change ensures
that binding records are properly sanitized before constraint
addition is attempted.

Change-Id: Iace190916c9c0b9be75ddd43c4ca86480f8e017f
Closes-Bug: #1442683
'}]
commit_message:
Fix routerid constraint migration

The migration to add a fk constraint to the routerl3agentbindings
table could fail if orphaned records existed.  This change ensures
that binding records are properly sanitized before constraint
addition is attempted.

Change-Id: Iace190916c9c0b9be75ddd43c4ca86480f8e017f
Closes-Bug: #1442683

commit_message:
Replaces screenshots for net verification feature

The previous ones had poor quality.
This commit fixes the problem and provides
a small note in Deploy subsection.

Related-Bug: 1415520

Change-Id: Ibd5ac69db15a589ee7e746f8c95e6e7a835a3422

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* basic_keystone_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.

Change-Id: Iefb20b56a1a5c9510fbe0f49e76bcf7adc0c7543
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Adds FAQ content to the Murano docs

This patch adds FAQ to the Developing Applications
section.

Co-Authored-By: Ekaterina Chernova <efedorova@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Olena Logvinova <ologvinova@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I019cbe6ed14fc4e8db02b7643cdf57e320d75167

commit_message:
Step-by-Step

1. Adds step-by-step section to the AppDev guide (based on
ApacheHTTPServer application)

2. Adds some dependent files: 3 images for step-by-step
and prepare_lab.rst to the Admin guide for prerequisites.

Change-Id: I4c57214a0bd37f04a093221597b72c1c5e560f16

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 19:02:16.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Allow users to run 'tox -epy34'"

This reverts commit 8db41f04d54526104920f3a160203ecf7ef453b0.

This patch causes breakage with installing neutron with pip.  A quick
revert will allow that various jenkins jobs that were broken by this
to run again while a fix is worked out.

Change-Id: I5e754b496a197ed8bb654c7d630871abc96119f7
Closes-bug: #1454372
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Allow users to run 'tox -epy34'"

This reverts commit 8db41f04d54526104920f3a160203ecf7ef453b0.

This patch causes breakage with installing neutron with pip.  A quick
revert will allow that various jenkins jobs that were broken by this
to run again while a fix is worked out.

Change-Id: I5e754b496a197ed8bb654c7d630871abc96119f7
Closes-bug: #1454372

commit_message:
Always validate metric name even if no dimensions

Also remove old services validation code. Don't need it.

Change-Id: Iebeb260b07d9b4820e9a7fc2ce907e93eedd30e1

commit_message:
Remove arbitrary devstack config options

Use the var DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG in project-cofig
job templates to pass through arbitrary devstack
config options.

This change reverts some devstack-gate options in
favor of passing them directly to devstack.

Depends-On: I01dc762f0ba1bc52bdeb5c434039bd5ab30cce1e
Change-Id: Ib5e6f081201855ad5fc5fd97323811c035654601

[{'created': '2015-04-02 22:39:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron file_line dependency

Without this patch, on Ubuntu the neutron module will sometimes try to
apply the NEUTRON_LUGIN_CONFIG file line change to the file
/etc/default/neutron-server before it exists. On Ubuntu, this file is
managed by the neutron-server package. Since we otherwise do not need
to manage that file on its own, we add a dependency on the package
resource to make sure the file will be in place before trying to modify
it with file_line.

Change-Id: Ic6905fe4240934f526e4b0d21bee695c8d93f28c

Without this patch, on Ubuntu the neutron module will sometimes try to
apply the NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONFIG file line change to the file
/etc/default/neutron-server before it exists. On Ubuntu, this file is
managed by the neutron-server package. Since we otherwise do not need
to manage that file on its own, we add a dependency on the package

Change-Id: Ic6905fe4240934f526e4b0d21bee695c8d93f28c'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron file_line dependency

Without this patch, on Ubuntu the neutron module will sometimes try to
apply the NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONFIG file line change to the file
/etc/default/neutron-server before it exists. On Ubuntu, this file is
managed by the neutron-server package. Since we otherwise do not need
to manage that file on its own, we add a dependency on the package
resource to make sure the file will be in place before trying to modify
it with file_line.

Change-Id: Ic6905fe4240934f526e4b0d21bee695c8d93f28c

commit_message:
Rename fuel-release to fuel

Fuel package which pulls in all Fuel Master
RPM dependencies is better named as fuel,
while fuel-release should include a release file
and YUM config, which is not ready yet.

blueprint package-fuel-components

Change-Id: Iacdb9886fd8fa9db130e9ea135f6ecf1e59c7a46

[{'created': '2015-05-12 22:52:39.000000000', 'message': "Improves Heat Demo Functionality

Previously, the Heat demo suffered from the following limitations:

1. The number of Nova instances to spawn and the image flavor were
   hard coded in the Heat template.

2. No outputs existed. This required users to run nova-list to
   obtain the IP's of VMs.

3. No documentation existed.

This patch addresses the above limitations.

Change-Id: I495aa9c73a91200c01cecc1719ee5532c1f6c9cb
"}]
commit_message:
Improves Heat Demo Functionality

Previously, the Heat demo suffered from the following limitations:

1. The number of Nova instances to spawn and the image flavor were
   hard coded in the Heat template.

2. No outputs existed. This required users to run nova-list to
   obtain the IP's of VMs.

3. No documentation existed.

This patch addresses the above limitations.

Change-Id: I495aa9c73a91200c01cecc1719ee5532c1f6c9cb

(1 comment)

Justin, thanks for your contribution. I'm not actually sure the remove command should be added to the kolla script, I first added it when I wrote the kolla script but then changed my mind and wrote a docker-compose-all script (Id9eb302094670c4b3ee4d96ff8c3c3cd0054b3e9) so that we're not limited with the options passed to docker-compose.

See my comments about dropping the "remove" command in Id9eb302094670c4b3ee4d96ff8c3c3cd0054b3e9, and please share your opinion.'}, {'account_id': 16110, 'date': '2015-05-12 15:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16110, 'date': '2015-05-12 15:16:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I see what you're saying but in my opinion the name destroy implies you want to completely blast things (ie containers and volumes). I updated the patch set to add a description of exactly what the destroy command does - perhaps this remedies your concerns? If not I can remove it from the patch and just include the restart command but I use both regularly..."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-12 15:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I've just gotten feedback from one of our translators that exactly the opposite solution is desired:  The translator for French has shared that including the punctuation as part of the translatable material makes it much easier to create a correct translation.  In French a space is expected between the final word and the final punctuation, including a colon.  When the translator is looking at "Image Details:", its much easier from them to recognize where the space should go and they can create "Détails de l'image :".  Without the colon as part of the message its hard to know if they should add a trailing space or not.

Did you have feedback from another translator driving the choice to exclude the colon from the translatable message?'}, {'account_id': 10881, 'date': '2014-04-29 20:25:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I have no specific feedback, but was working from the bug description which advocated removing trailing colons from translation strings. If this is undesirable for some translations then it may not be possible to implement this change at all.

I'm new here so am not sure of the procedure but I guess someone will need to make a policy decision on this.

Is there an action I should take at this point, or should I just wait for others to decide on this issue?"}, {'account_id': 9981, 'date': '2014-04-29 22:14:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hmm, well let me try to correct my behavior a bit ...

Neill!  Welcome to Horizon and thanks for your contribution!  I do believe this is an important work effort and getting a consistent solution will be valuable.

AFAIK we don't have a well defined policy on this.  I commented because I was actually just about to open a bug on behalf of a translator with the exact opposite implementation suggestion (for reasons noted in my previous comment).

Maybe the next step is to start a discussion on the mailing list and get input from the i18n team.  I'll go ahead and start the discussion."}, {'account_id': 9981, 'date': '2014-04-29 22:29:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've emailed openstack-i18n@lists.openstack.org to get guidance.  But I wasn't a member of the list when i sent the mail, so there may be some delay while I get approval."}, {'account_id': 3108, 'date': '2014-05-01 09:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Here are two points from translation team, summarized from the discussion in the meeting:
1. The punctuation is necessary for a team to produce high quality translations, we should keep it, except spaces.
2. Developers should avoid to concatenate strings and use variables instead, in order to not use strings ending with spaces.'}, {'account_id': 9981, 'date': '2014-05-01 10:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2014-08-07 16:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

'}, {'created': '2014-04-03 00:19:51.000000000', 'message': 'Bug 1296075 - Needless duplication in strings

Remove trailing colons and/or spaces from msgids
to save translators work in translating duplicate strings.

I am wondering whether the same thing should be done for other
punctuation, but it does seem to mainly be colons that produce
duplicated strings.

commit_message:
Bug 1296075 - Needless duplication in strings

Remove trailing spaces from msgids to save translators work
in translating duplicate strings.

After comments from the translators I am leaving punctuation alone
I will remove traliing spaces only.

This commit has been updated to remove *po and *mo files as well as
files under common.

This patchset has been updated to rebase against master.

I have removed all of the changes that involved removing trailing
colons from the translation strings. Not much is left, possibly
because cleanup has been picked up when I rebased.

Changes that removed unnecessary default filters have been left in
this patchset, even if other changes have been reverted. It's a
small thing, but it seemed worthwhile to leave in.

Change-Id: Iab1ae392636c5d35bba62fae06237d5f8926a6cf
Closes-Bug: #1296075

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-11 16:17:44.000000000', 'message': "Hyper-V: Fixes cold migration / resize issue

Commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162999/ changed where the Hyper-V
VM configuration files are stored. The files are being stored in the same
folder as the instance. Performing a cold resize / migration will cause a
os.rename call on the instance's folder, which fails as long as there are
configuration files used by Hyper-V in that folder, thus resulting in a
failed migration and the instance ending up in ERROR state.

Hyper-V configuration files are stored in a subfolder of the instance's
folder (e.g.: C:\OpenStack\Instances\instance-000000b6\Virtual Machines).

This commit makes sure that Hyper-V configuration files are not being
moved during migration by skipping subfolders in the instance's folder.

Change-Id: I4874eed7d284fab241e4371e550a88270ca156f1
Closes-Bug: #1453835
"}, {'created': '2015-05-11 20:49:56.000000000', 'message': "Hyper-V: Fixes cold migration / resize issue

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes cold migration / resize issue

Commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/162999/ changed where the Hyper-V
VM configuration files are stored. The files are being stored in the same
folder as the instance. Performing a cold resize / migration will cause a
os.rename call on the instance's folder, which fails as long as there are
configuration files used by Hyper-V in that folder, thus resulting in a
failed migration and the instance ending up in ERROR state.

Hyper-V configuration files are stored in a subfolder of the instance's
folder (e.g.: C:\OpenStack\Instances\instance-000000b6\Virtual Machines).

This commit makes sure that Hyper-V configuration files are not being
moved during migration by skipping subfolders in the instance's folder.

Change-Id: I4874eed7d284fab241e4371e550a88270ca156f1
Closes-Bug: #1453835

commit_message:
Add Hyper-V storage QoS support

Hyper-V provides options to specify maximum/minimum IOPS per virtual
disk image.

By leveraging this feature, this blueprint proposes to add support
for setting QoS specs targeting instance local disks as well as
volumes exported through SMB.

Implements: bp hyperv-storage-qos
Change-Id: I4ce44c8b7ab54a0bfc8c7401e675876dbd109e2d

commit_message:
Allow private docker registries

Change the sed seperator to accept a namespace with a private registry
and add an option to specify the registry. Below is an example for a
registry located at 192.168.0.10:5000.

$ ./build-all-docker-images -r 192.168.0.10:5000

The final image name would be something like this:
'192.168.0.10:5000/kollaglue/centos-rdo-base'

All build, push, and pull commands will still function the same.

Change-Id: Ic0ff96bb8119ddfab15b99e9f1e21cfe8d321dab

[{'created': '2015-04-29 10:44:46.000000000', 'message': 'Hyper-V: restart serial console workers after instance power change

At the moment, the only way the Hyper-V handles unexpected power
state changes is via the manager periodic task. The issue is that
unexpected instance reboots are not handled at all.

After an instance is stopped, suspended or paused, the console log
workers are stopped as well as the serial console pipe is closed.
Those workers are never restarted unless a power change is triggered
by the manager.

This patch proposes an instance state event listener, emiting events
that can be handled by the manager, similar to the Libvirt driver
workflow.

Change-Id: Ia0a875707a7a37224efb333feab1503e83449cc4
Closes-Bug: #1428505

commit_message:
Hyper-V: restart serial console workers after instance power change

At the moment, the only way the Hyper-V handles unexpected power
state changes is via the manager periodic task. The issue is that
unexpected instance reboots are not handled at all.

After an instance is stopped, suspended or paused, the console log
workers are stopped as well as the serial console pipe is closed.
Those workers are never restarted unless a power change is triggered
by the manager.

This patch proposes an instance state event listener, emiting events
that can be handled by the manager, similar to the Libvirt driver
workflow.

Change-Id: Ia0a875707a7a37224efb333feab1503e83449cc4
Closes-Bug: #1428505

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Nova serial console access support

Hyper-V provides a solid interface for accessing serial ports via
named pipes, already employed in the Nova serial console log
implementation.
This patch makes use of this interface by implementing a simple TCP
socket proxy, providing access to instance serial console ports.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I58c328391a80ee8b81f66b2e09a1bfa4b26e584c
Implements: blueprint hyperv-serial-ports

commit_message:
Use fakes instead of mocks for data objects

We hit a nasty infinite recursion issue because we were passing mock's
to obj_to_dict which was setting the mock's attributes as attributes of
the returned Bunch objects. Really though, we should just not be turning
mock objects into Bunch's.

Change-Id: I91a69a87082b30e16545c45ef8705ef4e929d5ca

commit_message:
Bump pre-release to 2015.1.1

Also, add nosetest as a test-requirement to unblock dsvm.

Change-Id: I6c799d7e290286cd6c5fda1347b8cf77b48807d1

commit_message:
Use mysqlconnector as the sqlalchemy driver

This allows us to avoid the deadlocking issue seen with MySQLdb:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/switch-to-mysql-connector

Change-Id: I2b80aaa74e78f80cdba7c5ad3c06984ddabba443

commit_message:
Fix leaked mocks in the 'common' module if any

Make all test suites in the module extend 'trove_testtools.TestCase' to
enable dangling mock detector.

Change-Id: I378878a2e3129c2d694695fbe3bb4174826386be
Partial-Bug: 1448273

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 09:03:15.000000000', 'message': "Pass -x to pgrep to ensure strict pattern matching

Without the -x flag, 'pgrep logrotate' matches both 'logrotate' and
'fuel-logrotate', causing the script to exit too soon to do the actual
log rotation.

Change-Id: Ie836a4aa65e4a4c19c2ad7540a0fb0572d14f846
Closes-Bug: 1382515
"}]
commit_message:
Pass -x to pgrep to ensure strict pattern matching

Without the -x flag, 'pgrep logrotate' matches both 'logrotate' and
'fuel-logrotate', causing the script to exit too soon to do the actual
log rotation.

Change-Id: Ie836a4aa65e4a4c19c2ad7540a0fb0572d14f846
Closes-Bug: 1382515

commit_message:
Switch all uses of iteritems to use six instead

This commit switches all of the uses of iteritems in tempest to use
six.iteritems() instead so it can be run using python2 or python3.

commit_message:
Respect network type in upgrade_ha_one_controller_env test

Respect different types of networks when checking services is up
after deployment in test upgrade_ha_one_controller_env test.
Should wait for 2 networks if neutron enabled instead of 1 when
nova used.

Change-Id: I060b6f87724b26110b0d1d8eb64e1e3f41923afc
Closes-Bug: #1453246

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 09:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore time shifts in e2fsck on bootstrap

Added /etc/e2fsck.conf with ignoring of problems related with
time shifts between Fuel Master and bootstraped nodes.

Ignoring two problems:
 * PR_0_FUTURE_SB_LAST_WRITE (0x000032) - Last write time is in the future
 * PR_0_FUTURE_SB_LAST_MOUNT (0x000031) - Last mount time is in the future

Change-Id: Ie75538b92af9fdda0078a0a35799da5cde313fa5
Closes-Bug: #1452277
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore time shifts in e2fsck on bootstrap

Added /etc/e2fsck.conf with ignoring of problems related with
time shifts between Fuel Master and bootstraped nodes.

Ignoring two problems:
 * PR_0_FUTURE_SB_LAST_WRITE (0x000032) - Last write time is in the future
 * PR_0_FUTURE_SB_LAST_MOUNT (0x000031) - Last mount time is in the future

Change-Id: Ie75538b92af9fdda0078a0a35799da5cde313fa5
Closes-Bug: #1452277

commit_message:
mlnx MD: mlnx_direct removal

mlnx_direct is deprecated from Juno release. sriov-nic-switch
with macvtap port is the replacement for it.
This patch removes the mlnx_direct from mlnx MD and
from the supported vif_types.

Closes-Bug: #1453410

Change-Id: I7ee528dc04cdafa27455d5f8fd18c04c858466d8

commit_message:
Add python_version function to functions-common

This makes it possible to list virtual site-package directories
without statically stating the python version, which is a bit ugly.

Change-Id: I3e7ac39eb43cdc4f656e0c90f3bfb23545722aef

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 09:22:45.000000000', 'message': 'Updated glance API for creating public image

The glance command line parameter changed from
--public to --is-public {True|False}. Updated it in
documentation

Change-Id: Icfc81966608ace049fceef260ec2b18d9e3570bb
'}]
commit_message:
Updated glance API for creating public image

The glance command line parameter changed from
--public to --is-public {True|False}. Updated it in
documentation

Change-Id: Icfc81966608ace049fceef260ec2b18d9e3570bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-07 11:46:34.000000000', 'message': "Add minitest gem

minitest dependency is required to run acceptance tests
on CentOS without rspec throwing exception:
/usr/share/ruby/test/unit/assertions.rb:1:
    in `require': cannot load such file -- minitest/unit (LoadError)

Change-Id: I26d120a8d59ffa46958717c44e0bf4a69b73a279
Closes-bug: #1444736
"}]
commit_message:
Add minitest gem

minitest dependency is required to run acceptance tests
on CentOS without rspec throwing exception:
/usr/share/ruby/test/unit/assertions.rb:1:
    in `require': cannot load such file -- minitest/unit (LoadError)

Change-Id: I26d120a8d59ffa46958717c44e0bf4a69b73a279
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Merge migrate server tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers actions migrate, live migrate server
functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: Ie02bb74b9e9a33d18f984f9821171d91972c4f20

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-29 15:12:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove locking from network and subnet delete op

delete_subnet in Ml2 plugin instead of using SELECT FOR
UPDATE deletes the IPAllocations that can be auto-deleted
straight away.
An exception is raised if there are ports that cannot be
autodeleted.

delete_network in ML2 plugin tries to delete all ports
and subnets before performing the network deletion.
No lock is needed here - if some other process modifies
the Port or Subnet table, adding new items, the network
deletion will fail because of a violation of a foreign
key contraint.
In that case the operation will be retried.

Change-Id: Ib4e9441a95d6c80b92a43d55fdeb18d7b51a1cf3
Closes-bug: #1332917
(cherry picked from commit 532cd91fa79f6061399a1bf326a49c5e6f5ece6b)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove locking from network and subnet delete op

delete_subnet in Ml2 plugin instead of using SELECT FOR
UPDATE deletes the IPAllocations that can be auto-deleted
straight away.
An exception is raised if there are ports that cannot be
autodeleted.

delete_network in ML2 plugin tries to delete all ports
and subnets before performing the network deletion.
No lock is needed here - if some other process modifies
the Port or Subnet table, adding new items, the network
deletion will fail because of a violation of a foreign
key contraint.
In that case the operation will be retried.

Change-Id: Ib4e9441a95d6c80b92a43d55fdeb18d7b51a1cf3
Closes-bug: #1332917
(cherry picked from commit 532cd91fa79f6061399a1bf326a49c5e6f5ece6b)

[{'created': '2015-05-07 10:36:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes floating IP regression with multiple routers

During the refactor here:
Change-Id: I09e8a694cdff7f64a642a39b45cbd12422132806
Too much code was removed and caused floating ips to get miss assigned when
multiple routers with external networks in the same tenant are present. The
first router in the tenant was always being chosen. This patch adds back
some of the original code as well as a unit test.

Change-Id: I6f663cb1ce3e4a1340c415d13787a9855c4dcac2
Closes-Bug: 1422476
(cherry picked from commit 84bbcb6f2a5400112751517e41bb50b5056220e0)

commit_message:
Fixes floating IP regression with multiple routers

During the refactor here:
Change-Id: I09e8a694cdff7f64a642a39b45cbd12422132806
Too much code was removed and caused floating ips to get miss assigned when
multiple routers with external networks in the same tenant are present. The
first router in the tenant was always being chosen. This patch adds back
some of the original code as well as a unit test.

Change-Id: I6f663cb1ce3e4a1340c415d13787a9855c4dcac2
Closes-Bug: 1422476
(cherry picked from commit 84bbcb6f2a5400112751517e41bb50b5056220e0)

subject: Don't delete nodes not reachable by MCollective

[{'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-05 21:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-05 21:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-05 21:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-05 21:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-05 21:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/24/180324/4/check/noop/48c7618/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2015-05-06 11:00:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm concerned if it's necessary to fail the whole task when only a single node misbehaves. In scale stories that may make users' life harder."}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2015-05-06 11:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Forgot the score'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-06 13:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We might be able to put the unreachable node(s) in the error state but not abort the task (and exclude those nodes from the call to orchestrator.remove_nodes). I just figured making it obvious that there is a problem is better, like how we handle deletion of OSD nodes.'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2015-05-06 15:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I will try to summon Łukasz here. He's working on scaling problems so his opinion is pretty important."}, {'account_id': 13445, 'date': '2015-05-07 11:22:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

You might want also to take a look at

https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-astute/blob/master/lib/astute/nodes_remover.rb#L69

where I added the option 'mclient_remove' to explicitly skip MCollective step for a node and I use it for node removal (otherwise there are retries that take about 10 minutes altogether)."}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-07 15:20:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The issue isn't with the time it wastes trying to connect. The problem is that we remove the nodes from Cobbler and Nailgun before we try to run the erase_node agent.

This is a problem because once the node is removed from the Nailgun database its IPs will be assigned to a new node. So if we can't connect to MCollective we need to know that before we make permanent changes."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-07 17:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2015-05-08 13:15:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

There may also be a different kind of issue I'm worried about more: if a node started misbehaving an admin may want to remove it from the cluster. If there's no mcollective, it will stay there and will keep bothering other nodes."}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-11 21:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-11 21:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/24/180324/5/check/noop/58180f9/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-12 00:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-05-12 01:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/24/180324/6/check/noop/fd21d00/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 12200, 'date': '2015-05-12 12:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8907, 'date': '2015-05-12 12:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

i would +1 this change

1. it is clear that we should treat deletion of nodes as transaction and disallow any partial changes in parts of our arch

2. if mcollective isnt running on node - this node is not a part of fuel cluster, and we can not control it

3. i think we can adopt some kind of fault tolerance for deletion as well, but that is not an easy change. I am talking about different policies for removal of different roles

i dont see a way to predict what user wants us to do with particular nodes, what if he wants to remove 2 controller at once, and reconfigure third one to be stand alone controller (this is what will happen right now) - so this change is clearly better than what we have'}, {'account_id': 8829, 'date': '2015-05-12 13:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-05 21:14:46.000000000', 'message': "Don't delete nodes not reachable by MCollective

Nodes are checked for MCollective connectivity prior to deletion.
If any node is unreachable it will be put into 'error' state and
the entire deletion task will be aborted. This only occurs when
deleting individual nodes, not when deleting an entire cluster
or resetting it.

Change-Id: Ieda212d83c0354346db315eb7da27d416a728dbc
Closes-bug: #1449285

commit_message:
Don't delete nodes not reachable by MCollective

Nodes are checked for MCollective connectivity prior to deletion.
If any node is unreachable it will be put into 'error' state and
the entire deletion task will be aborted. This only occurs when
deleting individual nodes, not when deleting an entire cluster
or resetting it.

Change-Id: Ieda212d83c0354346db315eb7da27d416a728dbc
Closes-bug: #1449285

commit_message:
Fixes race condition and boosts the scheduling performance

This patch fixes a race-condition that occurs when the
scheduler tries to check for dvr serviceable ports before
it schedules a router when a subnet is associated with
a router.

Sometimes the dhcp port creation is delayed and so the
router is not scheduled to the l3-agent.

Also it boosts the scheduling performance on dvr-snat
node for scheduling a router.

This patch will provide a work around to fix this race
condition and to boost the scheduling performance
by scheduling a router on a dvr-snat when
dhcp is enabled on the provided subnet, instead of checking
all the available ports on the subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1442494
(cherry picked from commit c65d3ab6ad4589e6e4a6b488d2eb5d1e4cfee138)
Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_schedulers.py

Change-Id: I089fefdd8535bdc9ed90b3230438ab0bfb6aab4f

Fix find_network_host for test with file injection

-make function find_network_host as a global
-fix functions where used find_network_host

commit_message:
Remove is_compatible from versionutils

Following discussion on the spec, we are going to place is_compatible in
oslo.utils instead of oslo.log.

Change-Id: I247f79e029113770e850bfdfd07ec5a8e2795343

commit_message:
Make remove_in=0 (no removal) use a better syntax

Support remove_in=None to indicate no removal instead of remove_in=0
which is not clear when reading through code consuming the deprecated
decorator.

Change-Id: I97c02a5b5cd3b1fc6a71dc11c45414e0fbe4ef11

commit_message:
Add versionutils options to list_opts

Remove the list_opts function from versionutils and include the options
related to deprecation in the rest of the items returned from the
library's main list_opts.

Change-Id: Iaab5c89c899c787c5b5723d4e750eeab03073fc7

commit_message:
Add versionutils to API documentation

Add an automodule directive for the new module.

Clean up the existing docstring so it renders a bit more nicely.

Update the usage page to refer to the new location of versionutils.

Change-Id: Ib732509186e56ed2b39638129e2ec4272da1aa9d

commit_message:
Small default version change

- required as it's shown in nailgun fake mode
- from 5.0 to 6.1
- mocked version in test_node_nic_handler.TestHandlers.test_get_handler_with_NICs
  always to be 5.0 (different serialization was used before 6.1).
  Separate test for 6.1 already exists in same module

Change-Id: I9ac64ea516e699bda4a79ecd00446566891e21f2

commit_message:
Enable keystone wsgi support

* New task to deploy Apache and configure MPM
* Run keystone as Apache vhost
* Pull wsgi threads and priority configuration from upstream
  change-id: Ib05ac81381e169845b44b2ef7cb810a4d5db17de
* Pull custom file source for wsgi scripts from upstream
  change-id: I941bf8804982e9081812e076f7a736f413220047
* Fix for keystone spec tests (use concat 1.2.1 in fixtures)
* Use keystone.py wsgi script from packages instead of downloading
  it from puppet module. Requires deb package with this patch:
  https://review.fuel-infra.org/6251
  Until it's megred, we'll use upstream wsgi script for Debian

Change-Id: I85008079b0e922a4518c696a097238500132fa04
Closes-Bug: 1313662

[{'created': '2015-05-11 14:41:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Passing body for all requests but for TRACE

At the moment just the POST and PUT are the methods allowed to have a
body in the request. This change specifies that just the TRACE method
must not have a body and allows all the other method to have one as
specified by the RFC 7231.
The body could then be ignored in the specific class managing the
request but it should not be banned at the wsgi layer.

existing methods to add a new parameter (body=None) to avoid that they

'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Passing body for all requests but for TRACE

At the moment just the POST and PUT are the methods allowed to have a
body in the request. This change specifies that just the TRACE method
must not have a body and allows all the other method to have one as
specified by the RFC 7231.
The body could then be ignored in the specific class managing the
request but it should not be banned at the wsgi layer.

NOTE: This is a WIP at the moment if we have a consensus about this
proposal we might want to include in this change the modification of the
existing methods to add a new parameter (body=None) to avoid that they
raise the error "got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'" when they
are called with a body.

Change-Id: Ia44fb0a8b77dbfed491b0093440cde6fff395ef7

If volume is in 'in-use' state or invalid instance UUID
is passed to cinder os-attach api, then it returns 500 error
because InvalidVolume and InvalidUUID exceptions are raised
from manager, but not caught at api level.

1. In attach_volume() method of manager, db entry is made with
   instance UUID even it is invalid and another db call is made to
   update 'attach_status' of volume to 'error_attaching' for the
   previous entry.
   By moving instance UUID validation at api level we can avoid these
   unnecessary db calls and rpcapi call.
2. Caught RemoteError exception in the api and returned 400 error
   code if user passes invalid information of the volume.

Closes-Bug: 1449454
Change-Id: I2121b03b9f2310c40e0158627b7d4b9ba73a8f5d
"}, {'created': '2015-04-30 10:27:07.000000000', 'message': "Cinder os-attach api returns 500

"}]
commit_message:
Cinder os-attach api returns 500

If volume is in 'in-use' state or invalid instance UUID
is passed to cinder os-attach api, then it returns 500 error
because InvalidVolume and InvalidUUID exceptions are raised
from manager, but not caught at api level.

Caught RemoteError exception in the api and returned 400 error
code if user passes invalid information of the volume or invalid
instance UUID.

Closes-Bug: 1449454
Change-Id: I2121b03b9f2310c40e0158627b7d4b9ba73a8f5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 19:15:33.000000000', 'message': "Replace all occurrences of $ with $$ in vCenter

Backport from 6.1

OpenStack services may reference to previously defined variable in
configuration files using $ (dollar sign), e.g. 'metadata_host =
$my_ip'. Interpolation can be avoided by using $$.  Passwords often
contain metachars and $ is one of them.  We must replace all $
occurrences with $$, otherwise service will fail to start because it
cannot interpolate non-existing variable.

Change-Id: I3d2d0c3638935ec1a4421a5305a04b826cb32f89
Closes-bug: #1436083
"}]
commit_message:
Replace all occurrences of $ with $$ in vCenter

Backport from 6.1

OpenStack services may reference to previously defined variable in
configuration files using $ (dollar sign), e.g. 'metadata_host =
$my_ip'. Interpolation can be avoided by using $$.  Passwords often
contain metachars and $ is one of them.  We must replace all $
occurrences with $$, otherwise service will fail to start because it
cannot interpolate non-existing variable.

Change-Id: I3d2d0c3638935ec1a4421a5305a04b826cb32f89
Closes-bug: #1436083

[{'created': '2015-04-23 14:59:09.000000000', 'message': 're-raise exception with full traceback

Rather than raising the exception using the local reference, use a bare
raise to ensure that the original traceback is preserved. This reports
the error as coming from inside the plugin code, rather than from inside
stevedore, and helps with debugging.

Change-Id: I4d7c002f378fb6491aa5c9e262084d70924112de
'}]
commit_message:
re-raise exception with full traceback

Rather than raising the exception using the local reference, use a bare
raise to ensure that the original traceback is preserved. This reports
the error as coming from inside the plugin code, rather than from inside
stevedore, and helps with debugging.

Change-Id: I4d7c002f378fb6491aa5c9e262084d70924112de

commit_message:
Volume snapshot improvements

This spec covers a few updates to the volume snapshot
create and delete operations in the libvirt volume driver.
These are needed to fix up some issues in Nova/Cinder
related to volume file format handling and API cleanup.

Spec for blueprint volume-snapshot-improvements

Change-Id: If9ab6976d7bd2cfbfeca7e2a731c50233a77beee

subject: Keep an instance in queue and launch later when resources are available

The INFN proposal was discussed on the mailing list since there were multiple issues to resolve (such as token renewal).

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-July/039043.html

I suggest to validate on the -dev list that there is support from the Nova team since I think the response would be similar.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2015-04-20 00:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I have two concerns with this proposal:

- I do not believe that this functionality needs to live in nova. It would be relatively easy to implement this as a service separate to nova which could be deployed by those who want to do things like this. Adding this to nova would force all deployers to run this code, even if they have no desire to have this functionality.

- Secondly, I worry about resource wastage from a proposal like this. If we queue failed requests and execute them some arbitrary time later, then the user is going to need to actively monitor for when their instance becomes available. If they don't then an instance appears later and they don't notice and now they're getting billed for resources they might not actually be using and which might have been needed by someone else.

If we're requiring users to notice their instance finally got scheduled, why can't we just have the user request the instance every now and then until the request succeeds?

At the very least I'd like to see these issues explored in the spec, with most of them probably falling under the "alternatives" heading.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2015-04-20 20:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Agreed, I'm -1 on this being in Nova"}, {'account_id': 11503, 'date': '2015-04-21 09:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Michael and All, 
Thank you all for your valuable time and comments. 

I hope I have answered all your concerns. As a novice blueprint submitter, I may miss some of the points. Please excuse me for that. Kindly suggest how can I better this spec which can be suitable for all the users.

1.	By writing as a component to nova, makes it to specific to nova.  As basic changes like trigger of rpc call to nova queue when nova valid host comes from nova scheduler. These kind of changes has to been done in nova irrespective of we write as a component or as a service. Yes off course we can make this one as independent service.  In fact, we are also in considering making this out of nova, as there is a proposal that we can extend this functionality to cinder services. Cinder does not create a volume when no sufficient space is available. But it’s just a consideration, we have not concluded yet. 
As per our current working prototype, not each instance goes to QUEUED state or it forces users to run this code. This code is optional to execute.  Its administrators’ to decide whether to run nova queue service component.  Furthermore, we do provide a user Boolean queue option to boot an instance. For example in open stack horizon dashboard, during the launch instance we have a check box in advance options page. This input check box mainly referred as  “Queue” ,  when a user launches an instances along with checked “Queue” check box , that instance only  move to queue or wait status when not enough resources are  available. When a user does not check mark this new check box “Queue” , that instance will go to ERROR state on non availability of free resources.


2.	As the objective was to avoid waiting or monitoring time for user’s luck of availability of resources.  Let’s consider we don’t have a nova instance queue service. The scenario would be a user has to manual check the resources i.e. actively monitoring at short regular intervals of time. Now if the user has to check first user has to note down his requirements of flavor (RAM and vCPU) and after every interval of time he has to compare his requirements with free requirements that can be derived multiple sources. May be sometimes the user has to calculate because the RAM we get display and the free RAM that instance is going to use differs by ram allocation ratio.  There might be filter, which can obstruct an instance. Manual decision to launch an instance might be lengthier and a longer option. 
Let’s consider we have a nova instance queue service, so we can avoid manual calculations and also we can reduce our efforts to launch every time. This queue service will launch an instance only when a valid host has been found. Though there are chances that user might lose some amount of resources, which not being used. But we can overcome this by placing an appropriate notification system.  Current notification system is user will get a pop message in open stack dashboard when an instance from queued state comes to active state. Though a blueprint is in pipeline for open stack user based notification system from my side, which will mail or message to user about user’s instance launch. 
There is speculation that resource wastage is the major concern, but not in all the cases. There are user cases, where we can ignore resource wastage when it is minimal to user. The use cases like development and test environment will get the best use of the feature. For billable resource usage, there are many cases. It depends on the user on which category the user falls. There are various categories a user can billed for i.e the number of ports the user uses or amount of the RAM or vCPU the user has been reserved for. If the user is well aware of that after  some amount of time (though not a exact time) there are resources are being freed up or some of the instances of this tenant are  going to down, at time he can make sure that instance gets into queue. 


3.	Current prototype has also few additions, which are not part of this spec.  One addition is user priority based option and an instance expiry option. 
 A user priority option means that along with the queue option, a user can define the priority of instances (when he has more than one instance) to HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW. This priority is used, when the resources are free to launch an instance, to decide which instance should launch first. And specific cases and negative cases have been handled for this. 
An instance expiry option (development is in progress   ) gives the user to shelve the users’ instance at a particular time of interval.  The user can set the interval during the instance launch or when a instance has been in active state. 
Here we do need your comments on these two additions also. 

Please let me know how can I improve this and also your suggestion can be helpful to be part of this.'}, {'account_id': 11503, 'date': '2015-05-13 08:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon'}]

commit_message:
Keep an instance in queue and launch later when resources are available

To launch an instance critical resources like availability of RAM,
vCPU's are required .
In absence of RAM or vCPU, an instance cannot be launched.
This makes a user to wait till the resources are available and
re-try once again.

To overcome this , we planned to add a new service namely as N-queue.
N-queue , which would be part of Nova, will keep user requests of
instance launch in a queue and will launch instances when the
resources are available.

Change-Id: I1a655b44df9b85695904e899585f9a0095b53d62
Implements: blueprint instance-queue-on-insufficient-resources

[{'created': '2015-02-18 18:18:20.000000000', 'message': "ARP spoofing patch: Data structures for rules.

ARP cache poisoning is not actually prevented by the firewall
driver 'iptables_firewall'. We are adding the use of the ebtables
command - with a corresponding ebtables-driver - in order to create
Ethernet frame filtering rules, which prevent the sending of ARP
cache poisoning frames.

The complete patch is broken into smaller patch sets for easier review.

This patch set here includes the some classes for the maintenance of ebtable
chains and rules.

Note:
    This commit is based greatly on an original, now abandoned patch,
    presented for review here:

        https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70067/

Full spec can be found here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129090/

commit_message:
ARP spoofing patch: Data structures for rules.

ARP cache poisoning is not actually prevented by the firewall
driver 'iptables_firewall'. We are adding the use of the ebtables
command - with a corresponding ebtables-driver - in order to create
Ethernet frame filtering rules, which prevent the sending of ARP
cache poisoning frames.

The complete patch is broken into smaller patch sets for easier review.

This patch set here includes the some classes for the maintenance of ebtable
chains and rules.

Note:
    This commit is based greatly on an original, now abandoned patch,
    presented for review here:

        https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70067/

Full spec can be found here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/129090/

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I3c66e92cbe8883dcad843ad243388def3a96dbe5
Implements: blueprint arp-spoof-patch-ebtables
Related-Bug: 1274034
Co-Authored-By: jbrendel <jbrendel@cisco.com>

[{'created': '2015-05-12 14:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Check type match on create from source/snap

We used to allow creating from source/snap and specifying a
different type than the originating resource when doing so.
Once we started getting more drivers and more multi-backend
configurations, we implemented a check in volume.api that
took this away (broke it).  There have been a number of
arguments about whether this should be allowed or not, and
that it could fail after the rpc call leaving the user with
nothing more than a "failed" volume and no explanation as to
why.

This patch allows the capability, but checks validity at the
API layer before issuing the create call.  There are two
requirements for the new type specification to be valid:
1. There is only one backend (cinder-volume) topic configured
2. Both types in question specify the same volume_backend_name
If neither of these requirements are met, the user will receive
an "invalid type" error explaining that the type combination is
not compatible and that they should omit the type argument altogether.

Change-Id: I08bc5e9a8800ce3b27c7db90b7bff86d7d14359a
Closes-Bug: #1289931
'}]
commit_message:
Check type match on create from source/snap

We used to allow creating from source/snap and specifying a
different type than the originating resource when doing so.
Once we started getting more drivers and more multi-backend
configurations, we implemented a check in volume.api that
took this away (broke it).  There have been a number of
arguments about whether this should be allowed or not, and
that it could fail after the rpc call leaving the user with
nothing more than a "failed" volume and no explanation as to
why.

This patch allows the capability, but checks validity at the
API layer before issuing the create call.  There are two
requirements for the new type specification to be valid:
1. There is only one backend (cinder-volume) topic configured
2. Both types in question specify the same volume_backend_name
If neither of these requirements are met, the user will receive
an "invalid type" error explaining that the type combination is
not compatible and that they should omit the type argument altogether.

Change-Id: I08bc5e9a8800ce3b27c7db90b7bff86d7d14359a
Closes-Bug: #1289931

External access to pod deployed using kubelet hook

kubelet hook.

http://<floating_ip>:8080

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 20:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update Quickstart guide

I found some problems with the quick start guide.
* Client version was old
* share-network-create syntax was wrong
* Example conf file left out important project/tenant names

Change-Id: I5360b3dd3a51ef4f1823eaa940e51adf3f437b3d
'}]
commit_message:
Update Quickstart guide

I found some problems with the quick start guide.
* Client version was old
* share-network-create syntax was wrong
* Example conf file left out important project/tenant names

Change-Id: I5360b3dd3a51ef4f1823eaa940e51adf3f437b3d
