[{'created': '2015-04-29 19:58:42.000000000', 'message': "NetApp cDOT driver fails Tempest cleanup on clone workflows

During the create-from-snapshot workflow, the cDOT driver clones
the flexvol backing a share, and a job is started to split the
clone from its parent.  The Tempest tests that exercise this
feature attempt to delete all artifacts created for the test
(child flexvol, snapshot, parent flexvol) immediately after
the test assertions.  This rapid deletion wouldn't normally
happen in the field, but during the Tempest runs the clone
split is still occurring during the cleanup phase, so the
cleanup fails.  There isn't a great way to detect and prevent
the issue, so the workaround is to intercept the error and
retry a few times.

Closes-Bug: #1447339
Change-Id: If272eb3c8060c95510226672a8d1928bea0cc6cf

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver fails Tempest cleanup on clone workflows

During the create-from-snapshot workflow, the cDOT driver clones
the flexvol backing a share, and a job is started to split the
clone from its parent.  The Tempest tests that exercise this
feature attempt to delete all artifacts created for the test
(child flexvol, snapshot, parent flexvol) immediately after
the test assertions.  This rapid deletion wouldn't normally
happen in the field, but during the Tempest runs the clone
split is still occurring during the cleanup phase, so the
cleanup fails.  There isn't a great way to detect and prevent
the issue, so the workaround is to intercept the error and
retry a few times.

Closes-Bug: #1447339
Change-Id: If272eb3c8060c95510226672a8d1928bea0cc6cf

subject: setup-network: allow creation of multiple bridges

commit_message:
setup-network: allow creation of multiple bridges

This patch updates setup-network so that that a new
2nd arguement can be used to pass in BRIDGE_NAMES
to the script (default is just 'brbm'). This is
useful if you want to assign multiple baremetal
interfaces to your VMs to test a split out network
architecture.

Change-Id: Ie85eadb5b34c3678c6e4dee41800a374523c0732

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-27 16:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'create-nodes: allow multiple bridge names

This patch updates create-nodes so that it supports
configuring VMs which are attached to multiple baremetal
bridges. The name of the virtual machine (previously based
on the bridge) has been adjusted to concatonate all the
bridge names as a convention when naming virtual machines
with multiple bridges.

Change-Id: I5857629df7c8f7bc00c3a475a3e8ffc6f7e99c93

commit_message:
create-nodes: allow multiple bridge names

This patch updates create-nodes so that it supports
configuring VMs which are attached to multiple baremetal
bridges. The name of the virtual machine (previously based
on the bridge) has been adjusted to concatonate all the
bridge names as a convention when naming virtual machines
with multiple bridges.

Change-Id: I5857629df7c8f7bc00c3a475a3e8ffc6f7e99c93

commit_message:
Add Murano bundles to the catalog

 * Introduce 'In the Bundle' section for bundles
 * Add following bundles:
   * Application Servers Bundle
   * Container-based Apps Bundle
   * Databases Bundle
   * Docker & Kubernes Bundle
   * Monitoring Bundle
   * modified:   openstack_catalog/web/index.html

Change-Id: I324328fb24f8a43a8522dc5abd5ce409b8162ebb

work properly.

For more info, see the README files.

commit_message:
Fix leaked mocks in the 'instance' module if any

Make all test suites in the module extend 'trove_testtools.TestCase' to
enable dangling mock detector.

Change-Id: Ia1e2e0eaf469ef1d706093a65af604da36603ac9
Partial-Bug: 1448273

commit_message:
Add tools/run_functional.sh

Adds a place holder for what will be the entry point into the akanda
functional test suite.  devstack-gate will call this script via a
post_test_hook after it's spun up a devstack-backed cloud.  This is
a noop for now until the devstack-gate glue is in place and we have
something we can test.

Change-Id: Ieb25645801a32f1262ddb2967e834755f813892a

[{'created': '2015-04-17 04:32:53.000000000', 'message': 'Merge server metadata tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers metadata functional tests.

Change-Id: I6726ea5515db0c25e9a9a4356a50ddb03be92541

commit_message:
Merge server metadata tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges servers metadata functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I6726ea5515db0c25e9a9a4356a50ddb03be92541

commit_message:
fix net-create call for public1 in tools/init-runonce

The --router:external option is a boolean flag that doesn't take a value
(neutron client version 2.5.0). Passing True results in the following
error:

Invalid values_specs True

This patch simply removes the 'True' value.

Change-Id: If4b5305f37d50c14c767393eb21223b0e0b59494

commit_message:
Support for pluggable keystone client

Support for a pluggable keystone client so vendors can support
multiple keystone versions easily

Closes-bug: 1452818

commit_message:
Allow GRE to run on selected interface

A CIDR can now be defined for the private network when
using Neutron+GRE. The private network can be placed on
any physical interface.

Change-Id: I56491481217910ec5c0e5403eb93800c47911c4f
DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1285059

commit_message:
Revert "Set 'mtu=65000' for private network patchcord"

This commit temporarily introduced an issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1454278
This reverts commit fa2e332eca66442557916bd0606b650dfad9e8fd.

Change-Id: Ie519d93635830acd5e8d93dfd1061ff3bb19a48e
Related-bug: #1454278

Great. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2014-09-25 18:24:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Alistair, I tried getting coverage reports for the functional tests and overall it looks good. I think we just need a few more tests for the drivers, but I'm not sure how much we can do especially with fsystem driver.

To get the coverage reports, I had to make some small changes to in_process setup, you can see it here: https://titanpad.com/F5vw0wgVFX"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2014-09-26 16:13:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Thiago thanks for figuring out the config.

Re filesystem tests, your're right, we could create a tmpdir, write a file and then migrate - I did the same in unit tests iirc. Nice! But we'd need to make those tests Skip if not running in-process. I'll look into it."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2014-09-26 18:30:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Alistair, sounds good, I just didn't understand the comment about having to skip if not running in-process. why is that?"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2014-10-13 16:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2014-10-13 16:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2014-10-13 16:32:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

No changes to the functional tests in this version.

NB We don't want the fsystem driver to be configured by default, so we can't automatically run the fsystem tests - that will still require some manual setup.

The in-process skips all the new tests for Data Migration.

Stock:

[zaitcev@guren swift-tip]$ PYTHONPATH=$(pwd) SWIFT_TEST_IN_PROCESS=1 ./.functests
Ran 314 tests in 214.751s
OK (SKIP=13)

Change 123473:

[zaitcev@guren swift-fetch]$ PYTHONPATH=$(pwd) SWIFT_TEST_IN_PROCESS=1 ./.functests
Ran 322 tests in 87.871s
OK (SKIP=27)

You can see that all the new tests are skipped because the middleware is not configured. Maybe it's just one line in a pipline setting. Should be easy to fix, I hope."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2015-02-02 14:30:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

@Pete thanks. Yes, the migration middleware patch this depends doesn't add itself to the pipeline in the proxy-server.conf.sample so the in process tests will skip.

Since the underlying patch currently has a -2 I am marking this one as WIP."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2015-05-12 17:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Functional tests for data migration middleware

Tests for the swift migration driver will ony run
with auth version 1.0 (the driver does not support
other auth versions).

Tests for the filesystem driver are limited because
the functional tests cannot set up filesystem source
directories or files.

Also adds data-migration to proxy-server pipeline in
proxy-server.conf.sample and enables swift migration
driver by default.

Change-Id: Ibaf213a853325d931289270c04de882487ccc3ab

commit_message:
Add support for PowerVM Console

This change set adds support for the PowerVM VNC console.

Changes the remove vterm to always be invoked.  This shouldn't have a
performance impact if the console is not running.  Ensures proper clean
up on the system running the PowerVM API.

Change-Id: Ia6a5dd445410fcd5351c3528003a83ba659805bb

[{'created': '2015-05-12 14:55:07.000000000', 'message': 'Moving Mellanox UI section to experimental mode

Since Fuel 6.1 Mellanox Features are implemented in a Fuel plugin.
Hence, Mellanox Features UI section is deprecated and moving to
experimental mode in Fuel 6.1 and will be deleted in Fuel 7.0.

Closes-Bug: #1452799

Change-Id: Ia0a0ebbd07e7ed5673b28ad5e200cb835e41d585

commit_message:
Moving Mellanox UI section to experimental mode

Since Fuel 6.1 Mellanox Features are implemented in a Fuel plugin.
Hence, Mellanox Features UI section is deprecated and moving to
experimental mode in Fuel 6.1 and will be deleted in Fuel 7.0.

Closes-Bug: #1452799

Change-Id: Ia0a0ebbd07e7ed5673b28ad5e200cb835e41d585

commit_message:
Set 'mtu=65000' for private network patchcord

While we create private bridge and connect it to corresponded linux
bridge we should define maximum MTU for transit patchcord.

Closes-Bug: #1453145

Change-Id: I78020ab270d0ac696e4d291b37e8985798ee4710
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

[{'created': '2015-05-11 21:11:15.000000000', 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I783117608e1e6ea402e1c83309f80d994108baff
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I783117608e1e6ea402e1c83309f80d994108baff

This patch adds a new "Reporting" panel providing a couple graphs. This
is a start, and more data/graphs will be provided later.

commit_message:
Fix setup script misspelling and pkill flag

pkill -9 docker was killing setup_docker.sh execution, so add -x flag.

Added check for root permissions and host type.
Added executing user to docker group.

Change-Id: I82cfad64fa737666d888e2ab9350c8d42e2150bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 02:41:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't disable cloud-init if not installed part 2

During scripted snapshot image builds we remove python-setuptools on
rhel/centos 6. This uninstalls cloud-init on hpcloud centos6 builds
because cloud-init depends on setuptools. We don't actually need
cloud-init in hpcloud because they use dhcp and we have hard coded ssh
keys so just don't bother setting cloud-init config if the config dir in
/etc does not exist.

One could argue that we would possibly want cloud-init to regen host
keys for us, but centos' sshd service should do that for us if the host
keys do not exist.

Change-Id: I96621b0ab1574eb8db0f4394877d3c1fc8208576
"}]
commit_message:
Don't disable cloud-init if not installed part 2

During scripted snapshot image builds we remove python-setuptools on
rhel/centos 6. This uninstalls cloud-init on hpcloud centos6 builds
because cloud-init depends on setuptools. We don't actually need
cloud-init in hpcloud because they use dhcp and we have hard coded ssh
keys so just don't bother setting cloud-init config if the config dir in
/etc does not exist.

One could argue that we would possibly want cloud-init to regen host
keys for us, but centos' sshd service should do that for us if the host
keys do not exist.

Change-Id: I96621b0ab1574eb8db0f4394877d3c1fc8208576

When we're building nodepool images on top of minimal elements, there
will be no cloud-init, and therefore no need to disable cloud-init
datasources. In fact, trying to do so will be an error.

Change-Id: I98887c43566e07f2be9d2dc5fae6538078c7348e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't disable cloud-init if it is not installed

When we're building nodepool images on top of minimal elements, there
will be no cloud-init, and therefore no need to disable cloud-init
datasources. In fact, trying to do so will be an error.

Change-Id: I98887c43566e07f2be9d2dc5fae6538078c7348e

commit_message:
Test for `~/.pydistutils.cfg` existence before copying it

.pydistutils.cfg is added by Puppet and is not stricly required
to be able to run the devstack-gate script.

Change-Id: I3b31090b2501218784e0830bb5375803a43ab0ac

commit_message:
Added more resources to ceilometer collector

Added support for network resources.
Added support for volume resources.
Improved image collector, now reports the size as the quantity.

Change-Id: Ifaffcc7b16585ddf0c1fce8a556eadef829af9b8

[{'created': '2015-05-10 16:42:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't require NODEPOOL_SCRIPTDIR to be set

If someone is building an image locally and don't want to do anything
special with nodepool scripts, they should not need to set an env var.
The env var obviously still needs to be honored for nodepool operation
and for override.

Change-Id: I08076a8eafe7019e715b1b46633e8f603031a1ea
"}]
commit_message:
Don't require NODEPOOL_SCRIPTDIR to be set

If someone is building an image locally and don't want to do anything
special with nodepool scripts, they should not need to set an env var.
The env var obviously still needs to be honored for nodepool operation
and for override.

Change-Id: I08076a8eafe7019e715b1b46633e8f603031a1ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-11 19:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'Pass in keystone version and correct v2 URL to CLI

CLI tests for auth v2 were using the wrong URL, should be
CONF.identity.uri and not CONF.identity.auth_uri.  Also the
CLI requires the keystone version to be pass in (ie "3.0" for
keystone v3).

Change-Id: I7fd3994022bf4f4575cbffb75f48042d889792a9
'}]
commit_message:
Pass in keystone version and correct v2 URL to CLI

CLI tests for auth v2 were using the wrong URL, should be
CONF.identity.uri and not CONF.identity.auth_uri.  Also the
CLI requires the keystone version to be pass in (ie "3.0" for
keystone v3).

Change-Id: I7fd3994022bf4f4575cbffb75f48042d889792a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-08 18:47:36.000000000', 'message': "LBYL when catching unmapped exceptions

When an unexpected exception is thrown in Solum,
the wrapping of those exceptions itself throws an error
because not every exception has the attribute 'code',
and the original exception is swallowed as the AttributeError
is surfaced.

By looking before assuming the exception has .code, we can properly
surface the exception at least as a 500 for further investigation.

Change-Id: I754d956e6c72f4ae94c3ec3573674aee4f7df0bc
"}, {'created': '2015-05-08 21:56:19.000000000', 'message': "Check for code attribute in wrapped exceptions

When an unexpected exception is thrown in Solum,
the wrapping of those exceptions itself throws an error
because not every exception has the attribute 'code',
and the original exception is swallowed as the AttributeError
is surfaced.

By looking before assuming the exception has a code attribute,
we can properly surface the exception at least as a 500 for
further investigation.

Closes-Bug: 1453291
Change-Id: I754d956e6c72f4ae94c3ec3573674aee4f7df0bc
"}]
commit_message:
Check for code attribute in wrapped exceptions

When an unexpected exception is thrown in Solum,
the wrapping of those exceptions itself throws an error
because not every exception has the attribute 'code',
and the original exception is swallowed as the AttributeError
is surfaced.

By looking before assuming the exception has a code attribute,
we can properly surface the exception at least as a 500 for
further investigation.

Closes-Bug: 1453291
Change-Id: I754d956e6c72f4ae94c3ec3573674aee4f7df0bc

[{'created': '2015-04-28 22:26:16.000000000', 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I9891564317aa3cf84874debdc966e48fb270455e
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I9891564317aa3cf84874debdc966e48fb270455e

commit_message:
Send the correct user-agent to Keystone

When we execute an Openstack CLI command, keystone should log in
Keystone access log that the user-agent that made the request was
'python-openstackclient' instead of the default 'python-keystoneclient'.
Therefore, when we create the authentication session we
need to send the explicit user-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1453995

Change-Id: I75087fd4bb1ff1e6f2a911bc70bf8008268276bb

commit_message:
Add keystone v3 API to fetch revocation list

Currently in auth_token middleware, only the v2 keystoneclient API is
used to fetch the revocation list. However, the v3 keystoneclient API
should be implemented and used as well. There should be a check on the
value of auth_version, and the corresponding API should be called.

Change-Id: I1c48da9afadfbdae2f69820e0b89bc02ec54000e
Closes-Bug: #1451445

This new API change was merged into Neutron and
we can now use the bridge method directly

commit_message:
Remove set controller RPC message

Instead of using the RPC message from the plugin
to the L2 Agent use the compute node configuration.
The local.conf Q_DF_CONTROLLER_IP parameter is used to determine
the sdn controller ip and port

Change-Id: I43f47ca62b14a8b46165df222d0c65a868bedf4c

commit_message:
Expose function to get defaults dict

shade needs sane defaults for some of these too, but it's entirely
legitimate to use shade without having first created an os_client_config
object. Adding a function to get a copy of the defaults dict allows it to be
consumed as a single source or truth for default values.

Change-Id: I616d9492c7e0f53c48519cc8dacf3dfbd0082e36

commit_message:
Only add fall through cloud as a fall through

We only want do define the 'openstack' cloud if there are neither
environment varaibles nor config files. We need to define it as a place
to put passed-in-parameters in the case of neither, but we don't want it
any other time.

The behavior can now be described as:
- If you have a config file, you will get the clouds listed in it
- If you have environment variable, you will get a cloud named 'envvars'
- If you have neither, you will get a cloud named 'defaults'

Change-Id: I6752c1ccecf1ef979b2603246eeaab7da360c8a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-06 19:40:57.000000000', 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I474dcd9de166b00d02b3586858a28797e97a3231
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I474dcd9de166b00d02b3586858a28797e97a3231

commit_message:
Small changes in report_tempest_results.py

Earlier for test runs with the same names but different configurations
two test plan entries were created. Now for such test runs one test
plan entry is created.

Change-Id: I7f8fdea20fa32487d7dc9a4cef7df4eedbbc5172

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-08 01:20:09.000000000', 'message': 'Check type match on create from source/snap

We used to allow creating from source/snap and specifying a
different type than the originating resource when doing so.

Once we started gettign more drivers and more multi-backend
configurations, we implemented a check in volume.api that
took this away (broke it).  There have been a number of
arguments about whether this should be allowed or not, and
that it could fail after the rpc call leaving the user with
nothing more than a "failed" volume and no explanation as to
why.

This patch allows the capability, but checks validity at the
API layer before issuing the create call.  There are two
requirments for the new type specification to be valid:
1. There is only one backend (cinder-volume) topic configured
2. Both types in question specify the same volume_backend_name

If neither of these requirements are met, the user will recieve
an "invalid type" error explainign that the type combination is
not compatable and that they should omit the type argument altogether.

Change-Id: I35f245bac47ff83ca4065691fd64d11b5feaa300
Closes-Bug: #1289931
'}, {'created': '2015-05-09 15:09:01.000000000', 'message': 'Check type match on create from source/snap

We used to allow creating from source/snap and specifying a
different type than the originating resource when doing so.

Once we started getting more drivers and more multi-backend
configurations, we implemented a check in volume.api that
took this away (broke it).  There have been a number of
arguments about whether this should be allowed or not, and
that it could fail after the rpc call leaving the user with
nothing more than a "failed" volume and no explanation as to
why.

This patch allows the capability, but checks validity at the
API layer before issuing the create call.  There are two
requirements for the new type specification to be valid:
1. There is only one backend (cinder-volume) topic configured
2. Both types in question specify the same volume_backend_name

If neither of these requirements are met, the user will receive
an "invalid type" error explaining that the type combination is
not compatible and that they should omit the type argument altogether.

Change-Id: I35f245bac47ff83ca4065691fd64d11b5feaa300

commit_message:
Check type match on create from source/snap

We used to allow creating from source/snap and specifying a
different type than the originating resource when doing so.

Once we started getting more drivers and more multi-backend
configurations, we implemented a check in volume.api that
took this away (broke it).  There have been a number of
arguments about whether this should be allowed or not, and
that it could fail after the rpc call leaving the user with
nothing more than a "failed" volume and no explanation as to
why.

This patch allows the capability, but checks validity at the
API layer before issuing the create call.  There are two
requirements for the new type specification to be valid:
1. There is only one backend (cinder-volume) topic configured
2. Both types in question specify the same volume_backend_name

If neither of these requirements are met, the user will receive
an "invalid type" error explaining that the type combination is
not compatible and that they should omit the type argument altogether.

Change-Id: I35f245bac47ff83ca4065691fd64d11b5feaa300
Closes-Bug: #1289931

commit_message:
Add field name to error messages in object type checking

The coerce() methods in object fields generate ValueError
exceptions if an incorrect type is used. Most of the messages
do not indicate which field was involved although that information
is available in the coerce() methods. This change adds the
field name to the error messages.

Ported from:
Ic94d52f6019c5a5a291675e321f96f5c65beaf10

Co-Authored-By: Paul Murray <pmurray@hp.com>
Closes-Bug:  #1430681

Change-Id: I4a359ea1478481e81f66c9c20e0bcac79ccd6a3a

commit_message:
Add enum fieldtype field

In some case, one field should be limited to some value, like the
cpu architect field.

Make sure that when the value limitation is changed,
the fingerprint will be changed, so that a version bump should happen.

Ported (but changed for consistency) from:
I7848f8b934c169a76b1cfd875f7905273f9f914b

Co-Authored-By: yunhong jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iac498869d10d2238b3ddf704640cd152cb794099

Unit tests are failing without it, and the file
oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py has:
import webob.exc

So it's looking like webob is missing from requirements.txt.
This patch fixes that. Note that this should be fixed in
the kilo branch later on.

Change-Id: Ib0ac48aeea4f8413740af89340e3b094312fa6b4
(cherry picked from commit c7ff6a07cc1f5ff26823836debc66fa965912ff4)

commit_message:
Adds missing WebOb in requirements.txt

Unit tests are failing without it, and the file
oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py has:
import webob.exc

So it's looking like webob is missing from requirements.txt.
This patch fixes that. Note that this should be fixed in
the kilo branch later on.

Change-Id: Ib0ac48aeea4f8413740af89340e3b094312fa6b4
(cherry picked from commit c7ff6a07cc1f5ff26823836debc66fa965912ff4)

commit_message:
Uncap pymongo

Workarounds have been implemented so that OpenStack now works with
both pymongo 3.0 and earlier versions, so this cap can be removed.

Change-Id: Iabb723cf4129b094b69276deaff1126da033ab18
Closes-Bug: 1441393

commit_message:
Add support to add Tuskar-ui config to local_settings

Patch adds optional configuration for Tuskar-UI to local_settings template
so it is possible to to use puppet-horizon for Tuskar-UI post install
configuration

Change-Id: Iaacd9e1a95a38093bc442375151f2e05dd13771f

ovs is the Python library for interacting with Open vSwitch.  Neutron

now added to PyPI.

Info "For new Requirements" from the README:

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes.  It's included in the main openvswitch git tree and is maintained
by the ovs team.

- Is the library good code?

Yes.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

More testing is required as it's not clear what testing has already
been done.  It has no additional dependencies and I'm not aware of
anything else that would make Python 3 compatibility difficult.

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes.  Apache 2

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes.  This is already an OpenStack dependency.  It was just only
recently uploaded to PyPI to make testing in our CI easier.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

No.

commit_message:
global-requirements: Add ovs

ovs is the Python library for interacting with Open vSwitch.  Neutron
already uses this (starting in the Kilo release) but it was only just
now added to PyPI.

Info "For new Requirements" from the README:

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes.  It's included in the main openvswitch git tree and is maintained
by the ovs team.

- Is the library good code?

Yes.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

More testing is required as it's not clear what testing has already
been done.  It has no additional dependencies and I'm not aware of
anything else that would make Python 3 compatibility difficult.

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes.  Apache 2

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes.  This is already an OpenStack dependency.  It was just only
recently uploaded to PyPI to make testing in our CI easier.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

No.

Change-Id: Ieb40dce8448d8d10150540238e2ab8dded5bc743

A critical update to python cryptography was included in version
0.8.2, just released.  This update included a single fix for a
thread safety issue when initializing the OpenSSL backend used
for Fernet.

See https://cryptography.io/en/latest/changelog/#id1

Change-Id: I8453190d2b886bef776e207c28b063ebd12db20a
'}]
commit_message:
Bump cryptography to 0.8.2 for thread safety fix

A critical update to python cryptography was included in version
0.8.2, just released.  This update included a single fix for a
thread safety issue when initializing the OpenSSL backend used
for Fernet.

See https://cryptography.io/en/latest/changelog/#id1

Change-Id: I8453190d2b886bef776e207c28b063ebd12db20a

commit_message:
Force specify false for service management params

If the stack is deployed in a pacemaker setup force specify false for
all related service management parameters.

Aternative solution: I98a466c719afcc8737d8224e9a64aa5dffe86065

Change-Id: I1de69504e9aa3b788854ffc81387701fc82b5bf6

commit_message:
Create ServiceManage,ServiceEnabled,ServiceEnsure

This commits create three new parameters:

  * ServiceManage
  * ServiceEnabled
  * ServiceEnsure

Those parameters based on whether it is a (non-)pacemaker deployment
will be set to true or false to let the installer know how to deal about
service management.

Alternative Solution: I1de69504e9aa3b788854ffc81387701fc82b5bf6

Change-Id: I98a466c719afcc8737d8224e9a64aa5dffe86065

commit_message:
Check master node connection to repositories

Added CheckRepositoryConnectionTask which tries to retrieve files from
repositories and fails if it cannot do it. This check is performed
before provisioning takes place, so it covers the IBP need
for master node to have access to repositories for building an image.

Above task is mocked for integration tests.

Fake task mode causes retrieving failed repositories method to be
replaced by method always returning empty list.

Change-Id: I1af89833e7de8447e73b9d9f00dcc2d9170ea35f
Partial-Bug: #1439686

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-11 15:27:24.000000000', 'message': "Rewrite extension checking methods

Old implementation didn't work, was using ad-hoc caching and its name
was too generic. Moreover it exposed 2 methods that should be private
as Shade aims to hide implementation details.

This change-set gets rid of extension_cache() and has_extension()
methods and create _nova_extensions() and _has_nova_extension()
methods.
Caching is performed using _cache_on_arguments decorator.

Change-Id: I6aa3ed5a306159ba477d15810138b3a4fb5a3649
"}, {'created': '2015-05-11 16:25:16.000000000', 'message': "Rewrite extension checking methods

Old implementation didn't work, was using ad-hoc caching and its name
was too generic. Moreover it exposed 2 methods that should be private
as Shade aims to hide implementation details.

This change-set gets rid of extension_cache() and has_extension()
methods and create _nova_extensions() and _has_nova_extension()
methods.
Caching is performed using _cache_on_arguments decorator.

Change-Id: I6aa3ed5a306159ba477d15810138b3a4fb5a3649
"}]
commit_message:
Rewrite extension checking methods

Old implementation didn't work, was using ad-hoc caching and its name
was too generic. Moreover it exposed 2 methods that should be private
as Shade aims to hide implementation details.

This change-set gets rid of extension_cache() and has_extension()
methods and create _nova_extensions() and _has_nova_extension()
methods.
Caching is performed using _cache_on_arguments decorator.

Change-Id: I6aa3ed5a306159ba477d15810138b3a4fb5a3649

commit_message:
Update images API for get/list/search interface

Images API now conforms to the new search interface. This required
us to no longer return a dict of images keyed by image ID, but, rather,
just a list if images.

The 'exclude' argument to get_image() was not being used by either
nodepool or the Ansible modules, so this was simply removed to make
that method conform to the standard interface. However, it is still
used by the Ansible modules in get_image_id(), so that functionality
is kept intact.

Change-Id: Icf825fcb0471de4acb08b59b93a4dfcd399b4c69

commit_message:
Update server API for get/list/search interface

Support the new search interface, and transform the server objects
to Bunch objects.

Change-Id: Ic8ea3e79863e11b4a00f104557966c81e2f06388
